lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/alioth.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run alioth.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'

Alioth is a charming, princess-themed chatbot designed to help you manage your daily tasks with grace and efficiency. Whether you are tracking deadlines or planning a royal ball, Alioth ensures your "Royal Records" are always in order.
* **Java 17** or above installed on your system.
2. Place the file in any folder of your choice.
3. Open your terminal or command prompt.
4. Navigate to the folder where you placed the file using the `cd` command:
5. Launch Alioth by running the following command:
Adds a simple task without any date or time constraints to your royal records.
Whistle while you work! I have added this task:
Now your kingdom has 1 tasks to complete!
Adds a task that must be completed by a specific date. Alioth uses a standardized format to ensure you aren't late for the ball!
Whistle while you work! I have added this task:
Now your kingdom has 2 tasks to complete!
Adds a task with a specific start and end time. Perfect for scheduling tea parties or study sessions.
Whistle while you work! I have added this task:
[E][ ] Royal Tea Party (from: Feb 25 2026 14:00 to: Feb 25 2026 16:00)
Now your kingdom has 3 tasks to complete!
Allows you to create a "secret name" for any command to work faster.
A new secret name! ls is now list. How exciting!
Displays all the tasks currently saved in your royal records.
Checking royal records... Here are the tasks:
3. [E][ ] Royal Tea Party (from: Feb 25 2026 14:00 to: Feb 25 2026 16:00)
Marks a task as completed once you have finished it.
Hooray! A dream come true! I marked this as done:
You are doing such a wonderful job!
Changes a task's status back to "not done" if you need to revisit it.
Oh! I have marked this task as not done yet:
Searches your records for tasks containing a specific keyword.
I found these matching tasks in the garden:
Displays all current secret names and the commands they represent.
Removes a specific secret name when you no longer need the shortcut.
The magic is gone! jjsj is no longer a secret name.
Removes a task from your list permanently.
Let it go! I have removed this task for you:
Your path is clearer now with 3 tasks left.
Goodbye for now! I hope all your dreams come true!
Come back to the castle soon!

* Error messages using a sweet princess personality with direct command examples.
LEADING_SPACES("Oh dear! A princess loves a tidy room. "
+ "Please do not start your command with any spaces!"),
UNKNOWN_COMMAND("Oh my! I have never heard of that command in all the kingdom. "
+ "Could you please try a different word?"),
INVALID_TODO("A princess needs a plan! Please tell me what you want to do. "
INVALID_DEADLINE("Oh no! We must not be late for the royal ball! "
INVALID_EVENT("We are having a party! Please tell me when it starts and ends using: "
EVENT_CHRONOLOGY("How sad! Time is a fickle thing. "
+ "You cannot start a party after it has already ended, darling."),
INVALID_MARK("Wait! I can only mark a task as done if you give me its royal number. "
INVALID_UNMARK("Oh! Did you change your mind? "
+ "Please use the task number so I can unmark it: unmark <number>"),
INVALID_DELETE("Goodbye, task! But I need to know which number to remove first. "
INVALID_FIND("I can find anything! But you must give me a word to look for, like: "
INVALID_ALIAS("A new secret name! How exciting! Please use: alias <alias> <command>"),
INVALID_UNALIAS("The magic is gone! To stop the shortcut, use: unalias <alias>"),
INVALID_ALIAS_WORD("Oh! Just around the riverbend, we only use letters for our aliases."),
ALIAS_ALREADY_EXISTS("Oh! This secret name is already used in the royal records: %s"),
NO_SUCH_ALIAS("I looked everywhere in the palace, but I cannot find that alias: %s"),
ALIAS_IS_COMMAND_WORD("%s is a royal word already. You cannot change a king's command!"),
UNKNOWN_ALIAS_TARGET("Heigh-ho! I don't know the command for: %s"),
DUPLICATE("Oh heavens! This task already exists in your royal records."),
SAVE_ERROR("Oh no! The magic mirror has clouded over. I could not save your tasks.");

* Integration tests for the Alioth chatbot.
* Tests that the welcome message is correctly retrieved for the GUI.
* Tests a full interaction cycle: input -> command -> response.
String response = alioth.getResponse("todo Bake royal cake");
* Tests that errors are caught and formatted correctly for the GUI.
// Leading spaces are forbidden in Alioth's kingdom
assertTrue(response.contains("Oh dear! A princess loves a tidy room."));
* Tests for the AddDeadlineCommand to ensure robust parsing and duplicate checking.

* Tests that tasks can be saved to and loaded from disk successfully.

* Tests that dates are saved/loaded consistently regardless of System Locale.

"The month should remain in English regardless of system locale.");
* Tests for the Event task to verify dual-date formatting and status updates.

Event event = new Event("Jedi Training", from, to);

* Tests for the TaskList class to verify list management and search logic.
* Initializes an empty task list before each test.
* Tests that adding a task increases the list size.
* Tests that a task can be retrieved correctly by its index.

* Tests that the find method returns only tasks containing the keyword.
* Tests that duplicates are correctly identified.
assertTrue(taskList.containsDuplicate(t2), "Identical tasks should be flagged as duplicates.");
* Tests that distinct tasks are not flagged as duplicates.
* Tests for the base Task class to verify core status and description logic.
* Tests that a new task is created with the correct description and "not done" status.
Task task = new Task("Read royal scrolls");
assertFalse(task.isDone(), "A new task should be incomplete by default.");
* Tests that the completion status can be updated and retrieved.
Task task = new Task("Visit the garden");
* Tests that the toString method provides the correct status icons.
Task task = new Task("Prepare for the ball");
assertEquals("[ ] Prepare for the ball", task.toString());
assertEquals("[X] Prepare for the ball", task.toString());
* Tests for the Ui class to ensure royal messaging and buffering work correctly.
* Sets up a fresh UI instance before each test.
* Tests that the welcome message is correctly buffered.
* Tests that consumeOutput clears the internal buffer after being called.
assertEquals("", ui.consumeOutput(), "Buffer should be empty after consumption.");
* Tests the formatting of the royal task list.
* Tests that formatError produces a standalone string without affecting the buffer.
assertEquals("", ui.consumeOutput(), "formatError should not populate the main buffer.");
